intro: Clarkia borealis, commonly known as the mountain clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Clarkia borealis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
